page.title: 12Farming
page.content: We went to visit Mr. Gaymer who lives at Dunsteads and owns a medium sized farm. His farm covers about 11000 acres and is about average for our area. Most of the farms are arable rather than dairy. He grows mostly winter barley, winter wheat and summer barley. Rape is also grown as a side crop after three years to retain the moisture in the earth. Peas are also grown for the same purpose. Fertilizers are used to kill the weeds: sometimes chemicals can destroy the crops as well if a spray system on the back of a tractor stops and an excessive amount of chemical floods out. Pigeons can be a nuiscance when they land on the side of rape fields and pull the stems from the roots. The fields have been enlarged by removing the ditches and hedgerows.
